msContents.summary: Receipt for payment of 2 7/24 carats for tax, the demosia. Could refer to the land tax in particular or public taxes in general. Received by Kollouthos also called Stephanos

msItem.note: Written across the fibers; back blank
Two columns: col. I, 5 lines, col. II, 5 lines; broken at left
The hand is a small, ornate cursive
One complete receipt, ends of lines of a preceding receipt

div.ab: Holding of Hermaion, from the heirs. Kollouthos, also called Stephanos, has received from you in full the payment for demosia (a public tax) of the sixth indiction for the third part, two and one sixth and one eighth of keratia in gold, totals 2 1/6 1/8 keratia, and for your guarantee I have made the receipt, as appropriate. [l. 5] Kollouthos, also called Stephanos. [fragment of second receipt] . . . from Ammonios, riparius (= a police official); I have received in full from you; . . . sixteen keratia, total 16 ker.; . . . and for your guarantee I have made the receipt; [l. 10] . . . as appropriate. Kollouthos also called Stephanos.
